Back from a successful Satyagraha at Rajghat to protest against Govts crackdown on innocent people peacefully protesting at RamLila grounds.
On the first day there was complete blackout in media though the entire leadership of principal opposition party was protesting at Rajghat.
Then there was a complete misrepresentation in the media about our Satyagraha.
There were serious political speeches by BJP leaders from 7 pm yesterday till midnight.
It is the tradition of our Party that we sing patriotic songs during all our protests and shivirs to keep up spirit of our workers.
Senior Party leaders also join in as an expression of comraderie with the Party workers.
In keeping with this tradition  I was asked to join in when Party workers were singing and dancing to the song 'Ye desh he veer jawano ka'
I stepped in for a brief moment to boost the morale of our Party workers.
This was around 2 in the morning.
I am shocked that this is the sole clipping picked up as representative visual of the Satyagraha and is being repeatedly telecast

Hum deshbakt log hain. Apni zindagi ki akhri saans tak hum deshbakti ke geet gayenge bhi  un pr jhoomenge bhi aur nachenge bhi.
Jinhe ye pasand nahi aa raha wo log ghulami ki mansikta se grast hain.
Pahle wo Vande matram ka virodh karte the  ab unhe rashtrbhakti ka koi bhi geet nahi suhata.
Those who do not like this suffer from mental slavery..
Those who do not like this suffer from mental slavery..
Earlier they felt ashamed on singing Vande matram.
Now they are opposed to all patriotic songs.
Our party workers were singing and dancing on 'Ye desh hai veer jawano ka.'
I was asked to step in. I did this as an act  of comraderie for a brief moment. The media is playing that short clip again and again.
Congress Party now says that I have not clarified as to what were we celebrating.
This song does not require any occasion or event to celebrate.This is a song in praise of our motherland.
The lyrics are 'Yeh desh hai veer jawanon ka  albelon ka mastano ka  Is desh ka yaaro kya kahna  ye desh hai dunia ka gahna'.
This means  'this is a country of brave people  distinguished and youthful people How great is this country.  It is a jewel of the world'.
Our party workers were singing this song to express their determination to safeguard the freedom and liberty of our country.
My question is :  Is singing a song in praise of your motherland an insult to Mahatama Gandhi ?
If we sing and dance to the song 'Mera rang de basanti chola' on the samadhi of Shahid Bhagat Singh  will it be an insult to  the martyr ?
My brothers and sisters  Vande matram. I am not the one to be cowed down by such people who do not appreciate our patriotic sentiments.

This day - 36 years back emergency was imposed on the country. Citizens lost their right to life and liberty.
Lakhs of innocent people were thrown in jail for 19 long months. Those protesting were subjected to torture and harassment.
The only reason was that the rulers then wanted to stay in power somehow.
Our young generation has not seen the freedom struggle.They have not seen the emergency and the country's struggle for democracy.
They should be told about this.
The present day rulers are showing similar tendencies.
The scant respect they have for parliamentary institutions and what happened in Ramlila Maidan on 4th June is a clear example of this.
We have to be on guard to see that the history  of emergency does not repeat itself.
Aaj hi ke din 36 varsh pahle desh mein emergency lagoo ki gayi thi. Aur nagrikon ke jeewan aur azadi ke adhikar smapt ho gaye the.
Kaaran ye tha us samay ke shasak kisi bhi tarah satta mein bane rahna chahte the.Is liye nirdosh logon ko 19 maheene jail mein rahna pada.
Baahar virodh karne walon ko yatnayein sahni padi.
Aj ki yuva peedi ne na to azadi ki ladai dekhi hai  aur na hi emergency ke baad hui loktantra ki raksha ki ladai dekhi hai.
Is liye avashyak hai ki unhe iski jankari ho.
Aj bhi shaskon mein kuchh vaisi hi pravritiyan deekh rahi hain.
Sansadiya sansthayon ke prati unka niradar aur Ramlila maidan mein Police ka taandav iska pratyaksh udahran hain.
Humein bahut chaukanne rahne ki zaroorat hai taaki emergency ka itihas punah na dohraya jaye.

In the All party meeting today  we took a firm stand that we are in favour of an effective and strong Lokpal Bill.
We want that the Lokpal should be selected in a transparent manner who should be able to function with complete independence.
We demanded that Government should introduce Lokpal Bill in the coming Monsoon Session of Parliament and send it to the Standing Committee.
All political parties  state Governments and members of civil society will be able to present their views to the standing committee.
Parliament may then pass a well considered Lokpal Bill in the winter session.
At the end of the meeting  a unanimous resolution was passed.
that "Government should bring an effective and strong Lokpal Bill in the next session by following the established procedure"

6th July - Dr. Shyama Prasad Mookerjee was born this day in 1901.
He was a Barrister and became Vice Chancellor of Calcutta University when he was only 33 years of age.
He resigned from the Nehru Cabinet and founded Bharatiya Jana Sangh on October 21  1951. He died in custody in Jammu & Kashmir in 1953.
Our respectful homage to Dr Shyama Prasad Mookerjee.
Today is the punyatithi of Babu Jagjivan Ram.
I got to know him in 1977 when I was Cabinet Minister in Haryana. Babuji was Defence Minister in Morarjibhai Government.
Babuji was a great administraror. He was a man of very few words and had common sense solution to most of the problems.
My shradhanjali to Babu Jagjivan Ram.
Dr. Shyama Prasad Mookerjee proclaimed 'India is one nation.We cannot not have two flags  two Constitutions and two Prime Ministers'
He protested against a system under which Indian citizens had to obtain a permit to enter J&K. Dr. Mookerjee defied this condition.
He died in Srinagar Camp jail under mysterious circumstances on June 23 1953 .Our salute to the great martyr Dr. Shyama Prasad Mookerjee.

Normally a cabinet reshuffle is undertaken to assess performance of Ministers and to correct imbalance amongst states and alliance partners.
The present reshuffle by Prime Minister Manmohan Singh has done just the opposite.
HRD and Telecom are both very important departments. After Raja's ouster Telecom was given as additional charge to HRD Minister temporarily.
The country was hoping that in the present reshuffle  the departments will have separate Cabinet Ministers.
Prime Minister has undermined the importance of these two departments. The temporary is now permanent.
DMK has refused to provide replacement for Maran and Raja.
The annoyance of the major allliance partner puts a question mark on the stability of this Government.
Madhya Pradesh has got a raw deal in this reshuffle. Kanti Lal Bhuria and Arun Yadav both have been dropped.
The reshuffle has been done without much thought and consideration.

13 July - Today is our wedding annniversary.
I got married to Swaraj Kaushal in 1975. We were both practising lawyers before Supreme Court of India.
I was elected to Haryana Assembly in 1977 and became the youngest Cabinet Minister in the country at the age of 25 years.
Swaraj ji was designated as a Senior Advocate by Supreme Court of India in 1986 and became the first Advocate General of Mizoram.
He was Governor of MIzoram for three years (1990-93).He holds the distinction of being youngest Governor in the country at 37 years of age.
He was Member of Parliament from 1998-2004.
Our only child is a daughter Bansuri. She is a Barrister from Inner Temple. She has done her Masters from Oxford University.
She is now practising in Delhi.
The routine statement of describing this as 'an act of cowardice' will not help.
We must introspect as a nation and find out as to what is wrong and where.
This requires some determined steps on our part.
We must prevent this.

The news report in Hindu dated 11th Aug quoting me as saying 'We will decide on functioning of Parliament' is a distorted report.
Let me explain the background. We demanded the resignation of Home Minister on account of repeated police atrocities on citizens in Delhi.
We cited three recent examples of Police atrocities like the brutal lathi charge on Delhi BJP workers in which a BJP worker lost his eye.
The second was midnight crackdown on Baba Ramdev supporters in which Rajbala is permanently disabled.
The 3rd was brutal lathicharge on Yuva Morcha workers in which more than 40 workers incl one who is physically challenged suffered fractures
A question was asked 'Shall BJP stall the Parliament till the Home Minister resigned ?'
My answer was "this is for today. We meet every morning to decide on the strategy for the day."
This was distorted and reported as "We will decide on the functioning of the Parliament"

I knew Bhupen da well.   I was greatly impressed by the fact that he obtained doctorate in journalism from Columbia University in 1952.

The ground water in Nalgonda district has 6-8PPM of Fluoride. The safe limit is 1 PPM.
As many as 6 lac people from 885 villages of Nalgonda are affected. 10 000 people are bedridden.
It is unfortunate that even after 64 years of independence  we are not able to provide safe drinking water to our people.
I will raise this in the coming session of Parliament. Government needs to wake up.

It appears the Government is not interested in running the House.
There was a consensus for discussion on price rise at 2 PM today. The adjournment motion on black money was agreed for Monday.
Today when discussion on price rise was to start at 2 PM the Finance Minister was not present in the House.
Parliamentary affairs Minister was also absent. In fact no Cabinet Minister was present.
Congress members from Telangana region carrying placard shouted slogans and did not allow the House to function.
We pleaded with the agitated members that BJP was all for Telangana.
We reiterated our support for Telangana and requested Congress members to allow discussion on price rise.
Congress Party made no efforts to control its members and the House was adjourned for the day.
In spite of our best efforts  the Government is not allowing the House to function and discuss price rise and black money.

I wish to ask Pranab Da : Who stalled the Parliament on thursday afternoon ?
Does he remember that there was a consesus in his presence that the price rise be discussed at 2 PM on thursday
and adjournment motion on blackmoney was to be taken up on Monday ?
All opposition leaders were present in the House for discussion on price rise at 2 PM on Thursday.
I am sorry to say that Finance Minister Shri Pranab Mukherjee was not present in the House.
Congress members started shouting slogans and disrupted the House.
I tried to pursuade them to let the House function but they did not listen. .
Nobody from Cong tried to control them and House had to be adjourned.
I am sorry it is Congress members who disrupt the House and Pranabda is appealing to the opposition.
Parliament is in session and Government announced a decision of such far reaching consequences outside the Parliament.
It is a contempt of the House.
They should have discussed this issue in the Parliament and taken a decision in accordance with the sense of the House.
They bypass the Parliament. We cannot accept this.

I am in Bhopal today. It is twenty seven years of Bhopal gas tragedy - the biggest industrial disaster in the world.
Union Carbide left 15 000 dead. Even third generation is suffering the physical disabilities. The ground water is contaminated.
US multinationals are not prepared to remove even the industrial waste.
Unfortunately the guilty men of this tragedy have gone scot free.
As we are opening the country to multinationals  we should also remember the Bhopal gas tragedy.
We must provide for effective safeguards for our country and people.

There is so much in common in our festivals.
In matters of celebration of Makar Sankranti  Khichdi is the common factor.
In north India Dal  Chawal  haldi  namak and ghee all ingredients of Khichdi are offered in temples.
In all homes  Khichdi is the dish of the day.
In Tamil Nadu  Makar Sankranti is called Pongal which is also a version of Khichdi.
On Makar Sankranti Khichdi is the reigning Queen.

The snatching of two little kids from their parents in Norway is shocking. I cannot imagine what the parents and (cont) http://t.co/w480ohrh
The snatching of two little kids from their parents in Norway is shocking. I cannot imagine what parents and kids must be going through.
I do not know the logic behind the Norwegian laws. One thing is clear - they do not know the Indian culture and sensibilities.   I
f feeding a child by hand or a child sleeping with parents is an offence  then all Indian parents including me are guilty of this.
The first principle of parenting is that a child should sleep with parents to instil in the child a sense of security.
The lesson of Indian parenting is in the Ganesha story. How Ganeshji got the elephant head.
We Indian mothers cannot sleep with our back to our kids.
I have spoken to Indian Ambassador in Oslo Mr R K Tyagi.
He told me that they are trying for an out of court settlement under which the extended family in India should be declared as foster family
and custody of children is given to them.
Let us pray this matter is resolved without delay so that the mental agony parents and children are going through is over.
Thank you Times Now for taking this up on behalf of Indian citizens.

Three year old baby girl Sangita kidnapped from CST station in Mumbai has been rescued in Haridwar after 27 days.
Lakhs of young children are kidnapped every year.
We request the Government to bring in a very stringent law to deal with the menace of kidnapping of children in the country.
The accused has told the Police that he kidnapped Sangita to use her for begging.
Whenever we see a child begging anywhere  we should make efforts to find out who that child is ? Has the child been kidnapped like Sangita ?
In case of doubt we should report to the Police and do everything to locate the parents and restore the child to them.

13th July 1975 - our wedding anniversary today http://t.co/BznHcdcp
Our Wedding anniversary today. I got married to Swaraj Kaushal on 13th July 1975 We were both practising  before  Supreme Court.
I joined politics in 1977 while Swaraj continued his practice in Criminal law.
He was designated Senior Advocate by Supreme Court of India in 1986 and was appointed Advocate General.
He became Governor of Mizoram in Feb1990and achieved the distinction of being youngest ever Governor in the country at 37 years of age
He was also a Member of Parliament (1998-2004).
Our only child is a daughter.
She studied at Oxford University and did her Barrister at law from Inner Temple. She is practising before Supreme Court.

Monsoon Session of Parliament begins on   8th August 2012
All party meeting called by the Hon'ble Speaker was held this morning at 11 am.
We propose to raise the following issues in the Parliament :
Ethnic violence in Kokrajhar (Assam)  Flood & drought situation in various states in the country  Exhorbitant increase in Fertilizer prices
Failure of 3 power grids simultaneously  Centre state relations  plight of handloom weavers  draft National Water Policy 2012
serious economic crisis  FDI in retail and shoot out incident in Wisconsin Gurudwara.
I will also raise the issue of missing/kidnapping of children in the country.
Shri Ajay Bhatt Leader of Opposition in Uttrakhand spoke to me about the need for emergency evacuation of pilgrims stranded in Uttarkashi
and Indo-China border road.
I have just spoken to Home Minister Shri Sushil Kumar Shinde and requested him to requisition Army and Airforce helicopters
and rescue the pilgrims immediately. He assured me that he will do the needful at the earliest.

Minister for Parliamentary Affairs telephoned me and suggested some dates for  Winter Session of Parliament. The proposed dates were :
a) a session commencing from 21st November to 21st December or b) starting from 26th November to 21st December or
c) a brief session from 26th November to 7th December or d) a staggered session for a week in November and a then in December.
I discussed this with my senior colleagues in the Party and NDA leaders.
We are agreeing with the first proposal that the Winter Session should be held from 21st November to 21st December as is normally held.
I have conveyed this to Home Minister Shri Sushil Kumar Shinde as Minister for Parly affairs is away.

There are some Questions as to why we are pressing for a discussion under R 184. I will explain.
The discussion under Rule 184 is followed by a vote whereas discussion under Rule 193 does not express the opinion of the House.
On 7th December 2011  the then Finance Minister categorically assured the House that the decision to implement the FDI in multi brand Retail
will be taken after a consensus is developed through the process of consultation with Political parties and Chief Ministers of States.
The Government violated this assurance and has unilaterally announced the decision to implement FDI in multi brand retail.
Now we are left with no choice other than expressing our opinion in the House.
This is possible only under a motion which is followed by a vote.
That is the reason why we are pressing for a discussion under Rule 184.

S/Shri Rajnath Singh  Arun Jaitley  Dharmendra Pradhan  V.Sathish and I were flying to Bangaluru for an election rally.
We had flown for about 45 minutes. The co pilot told us that the aircraft had developed a technical snag and we could not go further.
On landing the Pilot told us that the auto controls of the aircraft had stopped working. and he flew us back by manual controls.
By God's grace we are all safe.
I learn Ms Mamata Bannerjee Chief Minister was also heckled.
I strongly condemn this behaviour.  CPM leaders should apologise for this gross misconduct by their cadres.

I have stood behind this podium for five years speaking about this problem candidly and openly.
We acted in 2011 to acknowledge and to begin to repair this serious problem.
We now have a bipartisan reform plan which can  once and for all  fix this problem.
There are politicians  some of whom may be in this very room  who will tell you that we don’t need further pension and health benefit reform
They will tell you that this will just go away if we ignore it.  They will tell you that this is solvable if we just raise takes.
They will tell you that it won’t impact you  and that it’s going to be somebody else’s problem.
That someone else will pay.  You know that is not true.
Sometimes it doesn’t seem immediately apparent  but this problem is eating us away little by little.
We will miss the opportunity to give our young children the chance to be successful with a quality education no matter where they live…
…to become valued and contributing members of the community…
We will miss the opportunity to boost take home pay for working class taxpayers…
…by providing tax relief and new jobs which lead to fulfilling careers.
